title: As a user I want to be able to place a player on a short term MJ Injured list backdated to while they were on the Paternity or Bereavement list
custom_steps:
Starting with the 2024 clubs are allowed to place a major league player on one of the short term injured lists (7 day concussion, 10 day, 15 day) soon after being placed on Paternity or Bereavement list.   Currently ebis blocks any backdating of a transaction when there is a prior transaction in place â†’ the reinstatement from paternity/bereavement blocks the new IL placement

Ebis will be updated to allow a ML 7, 10, or 15 day IL placement to be backdated up to three days past either a bereavement or paternity list reinstatement.Â  The reinstatement transaction will be flagged as â€˜accountingâ€™ and will continue to show, but will no longer be factored into the playerâ€™s roster status or service.  The playerâ€™s roster status will now show as on IL for the days following the IL placement.  If the IL placement is on the same day as the inactive placement, the inactive placement will continue to be the first transaction on that day and will show that way in the playerâ€™s history, but the playerâ€™s status will never be â€˜inactiveâ€™ (only on IL)

There will be warning for clubs (on submission) and BOC on approval that the transaction is being entered prior to the bereavement/paternity list reinstatement.

title: SPIKE: Websocket/XHR connections during Draft
custom_steps:
During the Draft, we were seeing about 2-3 users per day at some point start hitting the eventbus xhr endpoints, indicating that their websocket connection failed and they are now using the XHR fallback.

2 potential actions to take here: 1. better understand why/when websocket connections fail and the retry mechanism, 2. make xhr flow more resilient and fix 404 / constant reconnect issue.

title: Prevent BData from receiving picks on API during Prod mocks
custom_steps:
There are times when we want to run a mock draft in Production after the BData team has turned their listener on, so we donâ€™t want them to see picks on the API, but we/BOC do want to see the picks.  BDataâ€™s user account is in the â€œUnassignedâ€� org but this org still sees all Production picks on the API, whether in mock mode or not.  We need to decide how we want to address this.

We will add a new RULE4-MOCK-API-VIEWER permission which will be checked for all picks going out when a mock is running.  Permission will not be a part of any role and will need to be manually added to anyone who needs it (and will not be granted to anyone to start)
